title: Build Kubernetes cluster
content:
Role Location
IT / Kubernetes Cluster administrator GCP Console

You need to use Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster to install OMT and the suite. Follow the steps below to create a new Kubernetes cluster:

  1. Log in to the Google Cloud Platform Console at https://console.cloud.google.com/.
  2. Click Kubernetes Engine > Clusters.
  3. Click CREATE, choose Standard cluster mode and click CONFIGURE.
  4. From the left navigation bar, select Cluster basics and populate the following fields:
    • Name: Give a name to the cluster.
    • Location type: Select Regional. Note that you can select Zonal for a development environment. Contact the support team at Support and services for details.
    • Zone/Region: Select the same zone or region as the prepared VPC.
    • Control plane version: Select a supported GKE version.
  5. From the left navigation bar, select default-pool under the NODE POOLS and populate the following fields:
    • Name: Give a name to the node pool.
    • Number of nodes (per zone): Refer to Sizing on GCP.
    • From the left navigation bar, select Nodes under your node pool and populate the following fields:
      • Image type: Select Container-Optimized OS containerd (cos_containerd).
      • Machine Type: Refer to Sizing on GCP.
      • Boot disk size (GB): Refer to Sizing on GCP.
    • From the left navigation bar, select Security under your node pool and populate the following fields:
      • Service account: Select Compute Engine default service account.
      • Access scopes: Select Allow full access to all Cloud APIs.
    • From the left navigation bar, select Metadata under your node pool, click + ADD KUBERNETES LABEL, and add two labels with the following details: 
      Key Value
      Worker label
      role loadbalancer
  6. From the left navigation bar, select Networking under CLUSTER and populate the following fields:
    • Select Private cluster, and deselect Access control plane using its external IP address. Set up an IP range in the Control plane IP range field.
    • Network: Select the prepared VPC.
    • Node subnet: Select the subnet prepared for the cluster.
    • Under Advanced networking options, do the following:
      • Select Enable VPC-native traffic routing (uses alias IP).
      • Pod address range: Make sure the range includes at least 1024 IPs. For example, 10.96.0.0/14.
      • Maximum Pods per node: Type 60.
      • Service address range: Make sure the range includes at least 256 IPs. For example, 10.94.0.0/18.
      • Select Enable HTTP load balancing option.
      • Select Enable control plane authorized networks.
      • Add authorized network: Add the networks that need to connect to the cluster as authorized networks. For example, the subnet prepared for the bastion.
  7. From the left navigation bar, select Security under CLUSTER and do the following:
    • Under Legacy security options, disable Enable legacy authorization and Issue a client certificate options.
  8. From the left navigation bar, select Features under CLUSTER and do the following:
    • Under Operations, disable Enable Cloud Logging and Enable Cloud Monitoring.
  9. Leave the remaining settings as is and click CREATE.

It will take several minutes for the cluster creation to finish. You can check the cluster status in the cluster list.

External references

For Google Kubernetes Engine information, see GKE Overview.
